alert.note: Alert for Sierra County Lakes (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Freeze Watch issued October 29 at 2:54PM MDT until October 31 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM MDT MONDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, north winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected. For the Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 28 possible. * WHERE...Sierra County Lakes. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, from 9 PM this evening to 4 AM MDT Monday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Monday night through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
